name: Hotel Berna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standout atribute for this hotel is the location - just a couple of minutes from the metro and the central railway station.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in a great location

reviews.text: We stayed in a first floor room for 4 nights in early September. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet at night although the bathroom was somewhat small.
reviews.title: near central station, small room

reviews.text: The staff were consistently friendly, efficient and helpful.
reviews.title: What a rip off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The great buffet breakfasts get the day off to a good start.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with exceptional service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As it was voted #3 on tripadvisor, I thought I had to go there. Friendly and efficient staff, check-in took me 5 minutes. The room was very very small, so was the bed. There was no street noise in the room, AC worked, the bathroom was not up to date but a little bit run down. The toilet was not fixed to the ground, so this can be shaky and dangerous. The breakfast buffet is above average Italian breakfasts, but has a limited selection of salami, ham and cheese. I would not recommend this hotel for a business trip and rather choose a hotel chain to stay next time. Also, the hotel is in the area of the central station. The touristy center is at the dome.
reviews.title: Hotel Berna was a pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the Executive room which is on the opposite side of the road to the main building. The room was OK, but seemed still to be standard rather than executive, and I am not sure what we paid the extra for... the free minibar was only soft drinks anyway, and everything else was in another building, so I would suggest you save your money for shopping and go with their standard double room!
reviews.title: Hotel OK, but prostitutes working on street outside!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a plus, the breakfast was lovely, and the staff were really helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was so much security to get in and out of the hotel (cameras. buzzers, etc), in addition to the prostitutes on the street outside, gave the feeling that perhaps this was not the safest of neighbourhoods....
reviews.title: Cute hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are a tourist, then I would suggest a hotel closer to the Duomo area as there was nothing really in this area in the evenings, and the surroundings didn't really entice you to stay there either.
reviews.title: The other reviews are true - this is a great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Central Station also has loads of beggars and drunks hanging around, so it makes you feel quite nervous if you plan to take the metro at night. I would suggest taking a taxi which cost 8 Euro from the hotel to the Duomo area
reviews.title: ok hotel for the price

reviews.text: I booked a very expensive single room (EUR 278 pp. per night with breakfast) but was still stunned by how small my room was! All of the furnishings were of fantastic quality and the entire premises were exceptionally clean. The staff were helpful, smiley and spoke English very well. The breakfast buffet was simply grand. There was enough food displayed to have fed the hotel guests for the next three days. In fact, it may have been a bit too decadent and lavishly wasteful in this day and age. Great WiFi and a minimum of fuss logging in.
reviews.title: Expensive, central, great staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast staff were attentive, charming and were not afraid to ask the guest about their country of origin, which was a welcome change to the anonymity of regular travel.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in a central location

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for a night before heading to Florence and Venice. Hotel was very close to Milan Centrale. We chose the 'Love birds in Milan' package and it was worth every penny with nice decoration and champagne. Breakfast spread was quite lavish and we loved every moment of our stay at Berna.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with wonderful staff!

reviews.text: I must say that we were a bit hesitant to book this hotel initially as the photos of the rooms appeared a little small and out-dated. I'm very pleased to say that we were pleasantly surprised and happy with this hotel. We occupied 2 rooms (1 double and 1 triple) to accommodate 5 adults. Both rooms were clean, well-maintained with lovely furnishings and adequate room to move. Above all, it was the staff and service which impressed us the most. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Especially at breakfast - we received service with a smile, we were made to feel especially welcome. Thank you very much to Hotel Berna and it's staff. We would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel to others travelling to Milan.
reviews.title: A value choice for biz/personal trip looking for a clean and convenient stay

reviews.text: The hotel is small but sweet. The room is very clean with good space; mini bar in room refilled every day is a very considerate offering. Speedy wifi in the hotel. The breakfast is very good with lots of choices changed on a daily basis. The hotel staffa are friendly and can speak English well. Sky TV in all rooms; two small lifts in the building. 5mins walking distance to Central FS station and supetmarkets nearby. The hotel has my highly recommendation.
reviews.title: Excellent service and very convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can not understand the excellet critics this hotel has. We stayed there in February and coudn`t sleep because of the cold. It is true that the people there is nice (when you have no problems), and the breakfast (probably one of the reasons of the good reviews, is ample and with good service). The hotel is old, though, at least in the old building, with rooms in need of refurbishment (and we were not in the cheapest one).
reviews.title: OK BUT, SUCH A HIGH POSITION?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But I believe that a hotel with such a high rank should have reacted better to the situation. The only thing they offered was more blankets, and they were not enough. And I have to clarify that, being February, the temperature in Milan was not ice cold. We stayed there for two nights but, even we complained both days, no solution was given to us. And no excuses when we left either. We ended our trip with a cold and a need of a good sleep, what we had not in Berna Hotel.
reviews.title: Exceptionally good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the reviews for the Hotel Berna our expectations were high but we were not disappointed. The hotel is less than a 10 minute walk from Milan Centrale station (for regional trains), the Metro (4 stops on the yellow line to the centre of Milan - 1.50 euros for a single journey or 4.50 euros for a day ticket) and airport buses (7.50 euros to Malpensa).
reviews.title: Dolce Vita

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had a very comfortable mattress. If you provide your preferences online before you arrive you can select the type of pillow you would like, what complimentary non-alcoholic drinks you want in your bar fridge and even the temperature you would like the airconditioning to be set on! Breakfast was excellent and you can help yourself any time to complimentary coffee or tea in the lounge area (there are no tea making facilities in the rooms). The only thing we could fault was that our computer would not connect to the free wifi in our room so we had to go downstairs to the lounge to use it. However there are several hotel computers that you can use in the reception and lounge area. We would certainly recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Great find in Milan

reviews.text: We had a great but short visit to Milan and would definitely stay at Hotel Berna again. The staff were extraordinarily helpful and the Sunday breakfast was amazing. The italian GP and the Hotel Berna in 2012 perhaps....?
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed here for 3 nights in February 2013 having looked a variety of options. Hotel Berna has a great location - 2mins walk from central train station (where the airport bus arrives/departs), a metro station at the end of the road with 2 lines that take you to all parts of the city - Duomo and main square are 5/10mins away by metro and only took 25mins to walk down a safe street route! Hotel was clean, breakfast variety was huge and available until 11am -and all of the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Room we were in was nice - for us it was just a place to sleep and shower so the fact it wasn't huge didn't make a difference - but there was a desk and free wifi in room and there is a PC/printer available for free in reception. Decor is a little dated and not "boutique" or "contemporary" but our room was very clean and added bonus of free soft drink minibar - which was very handy! Also cakes/snacks available on bar all day. Not the quietest of rooms as we were near the lift/stair well so heard people coming and going early morning - but we were getting up to go and enjoy the city anyway so no big deal! Very accommodating when we checked out and kept our luggage safely locked away while we went out to enjoy the city. Overall we had a lovely stay and would recommend the Hotel Berna.
reviews.title: nice hotel, good location, helpful staff

reviews.text: All the staff is extremely friendly, nice and helpful. Anytime I travel to Milano for business or pleasure I "live" there with them.....now it is my home when in Milano. One can choose different room categories but the breakfast is simply great for everyone with even large choice of gluten free pastry. Do not forget to have the carrott fresh juice, lovely for starting a day...
reviews.title: As being at home....

reviews.text: My husband, infant son, and I needed a place to stay for one night that was close to the central train station. Hotel Berna fit the bill perfectly. It was moderately priced, a few minute walk from the station, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms clean. We enjoyed the special touches of free (non alcoholic beverages) from the mini bar, free wi-fi, and the adorable rubber duckie we found in our bathroom- perfect for our son. I would recommend Hotel Berna to friends and family.
reviews.title: Just what we were looking for

reviews.text: Very nice hotel, conveniently located. Good breakfast, great choice. Incredibly nice service - everyone is more than incredibly nice... incredibly nice really is an understatement. We checked in at 12 instead of 3 p.m., got an upgrade because they misspelled Mr. instead of Ms. The room was reasonable, bathroom was very big. We asked for a quiet room and we got one with a view to the interior garden, all good in here. The minibar is for free! Only non-alcoholic beverages, but still incredibly nice touch! Rubber duck for free! Love it! The downside: it really is a 3 star. The room was quite old, at least judging it by the bathroom (the even had a very "optimistic" scale in the bathroom - it showed that I weigh 5 kg less! Loved it!). Shampoo and shower gel yes, no hand soap... The upholstery and carpet smelled like old and somewhat mouldy... The location and the price was unbeatable. However, remember, do not expect a 5 star room, you are in a 3 star hotel. It is amazing for a 3 star, but it is not a 5 star!
reviews.title: Yes, very good, but remember - it is a THREE STAR

reviews.text: I stayed here in December last year, and waited until now to review, as I wanted to be balanced about it. My impression was that it was a little like the 'Curate's egg'..parts of it were quite excellent. For example, the location, very close to the Central Station and easy to find. Lots of good cheap resturants very close by. The breakfast was fantastic, with a very large array of quality food. It's almost worth staying at the Hotel Berna for the breakfast alone. The bar was comfortable and welcoming, the drinks reasonably priced and generous, with nuts and crisps on the table, and some very delectable food on the bar, free and gratis. The staff, for the most part, were friendly and helpful. There were, however, a few things that spoiled it for me. The first was my arrival. The receptionist was dealing with a customer, which was fair enough, but I would have expected a smile and nod from him to acknowledge my existence. His attitude when he did get around to serving me was coolly polite, but certainly not welcoming. I was not shown to my room as I had been in other hotels of the same class in Europe, and the room was very hard to find, with the numbering confusing. The room itself was adequete, although the bathroom was truly minute, even for Europe. The worst part was the noise. I was closeted hard by two elevators, which clanked all night, and my room seemed to be the central juction for all the plumbing in the place. So my night was clank-clank, gurgle-gurgle, and i got hardly any sleep. I was advised by the desk that the hotel was fully booked. That may be so, but with a very long plane trip ahead of me next day, I could have done with some rest. They were apologetic, and looked after my bags next day until my afternoon departure, but wouldn't give me a late check-out so that I might have caught up on my sleep. They were too busy they said. All in all, my experience was mostly positive, and I would stay there again. However, next time I would be sure to request a QUIET room.
reviews.title: CURATE'S EGG.

reviews.text: My cousin and I stayed at the Berna Hotel for one night after we landed in Milan. Located in Milan Centrale, the hotel is 5 minutes walking distance away from the Metro and the train station which worked out really well for us as we needed to catch an early train to Verona the next morning. The various sights may be a bit far to walk to from the hotel, but by Metro it only took about 10 minutes. The hotel has an elevator which is an absolute must if you have large luggage (not all hotels in Italy have a lift which we found out the hard way). The room was clean and decent size equiped with a tv. The free wi-fi was an added bonus that was very much appreciated. The free breakfast is something to rave about and was probably the best I've ever come across in a European hotel. The selections were vast and unlimited. The pickiest eater can probably find something they like. The restaurants surrounding the hotel left more to be desired. We only ate at two restaurants around the area, and we found both to be tourist traps. One negative thing about the Berna Hotel was that I came across a couple of rude reception desk personnel, but that did not impact my stay there too much. If you're looking for a good value for a clean room in a convenient locale, definitely stay at Berna!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

reviews.text: I was travelling by train through Italy and Switzerland on a pleasure trip (68 year old retired businessman) and found Berna Hotel through Trip Advisor. I wanted something close to the central train station and found Berna the ideal spot. It is one short block from the station and is in an area with a lot of nice restaurants and facilities nearby. There is great small pizza restaurant literally next door (with TVs for watching Champions League football matches)Very up to date hotel, great breakfast buffet in the morning, very comfortable lobby bar with newssheets in all languages, and a great front desk staff. It is among the best of mid-priced traveller oriented hotels I have ever stayed at. Highly recommended!!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel near Central Station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked following positive feedback from other reviewers. Not disappointed.
reviews.title: Too many rabbits....

reviews.text: Rooms quiet and clean, water pressure in shower brilliant, staff as everyone has noted go out of their way to assist.
reviews.title: Comfortable choice near Milano Centrale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast fantastic although my only negative comment about the three day visit relates to the carrot juicer they have in the breakfast room. I have been to quieter rock concerts – very disconcerting to continually hear loud juicing when you are trying to enjoy a quiet meal. Sit outside near the bar!!
reviews.title: Small room but everything else was great

reviews.text: The Berna was great! This was our first stop after our transatlantic flight, so we were especially pleased to get a great night's sleep. Very close to Milano Centrale and to a metro stop. The room was very clean, quiet and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was incredible - by far the best we encountered on our month long stay in Italy. The staff was very professional and helpful and had excellent English. I thought it was a nice touch that they also sold metro tickets.
reviews.title: Stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As written by all the reviewers, this hotel knows how to treat a customer/guest. Great service with great staff. This hotel provided the best breakfast,in my entire trip. Location is also good, a 7-8 minute walk from the central station from where you could take a metro to anywhere in Milan. The room was romantically decorated with chocolates. Non alcoholic mini bar and a fruit basket is provided for free. They also offered a complimentary bottle of wine since we were on a honeymoon. Rooms are bit old but nice. Bathroom was spacious though. I would recommend this hotel to everyone visiting Milan.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with best customer service

reviews.text: Great location very near Milan Central station. Good service from both desk reception and the guy carries our luggage and shows us to our rooms. Breakfast is one of the best we've had during our trip in Italy. We were arranged to the 2nd building across the street. There is entrance guard system so we don't worry about the safety of our luggage. However, we were informed at the desk that we got upgraded for early booking but only 1 of the 2 rooms seem upgraded in room size. In the smaller room, the stainless shampoo holder in the shower is a little rusted and a hairpin left on it from some other guests. It's the only part which we think need to be improved. All in all, everything's quite satisfying. Will choose to stay here again.
reviews.title: good choice

reviews.text: Hotel Berna did not disappoint us! This hotel is the most genuinely hospitable hotel that I have ever stayed in. We received a very warm welcome with our two small children (they received cuddly toys on the bed) complimentary drinks & biscuits every day as did we. The little touches & service are really what makes this hotel very special. The guest is at the centre of all considerations which is exactly how it should be. Our room was superior with a lovely jacuzzi bath, clean & very comfortable. The breakfast was delicious & extensive in choice & we really enjoyed juicing carrots every morning. In fact the breakfast was more like a brunch as it filled us all up until late afternoon. We decided to visit Milan with the kids on a sight seeing short trip of 3 nights & I have to say the Hotel Berna was one of the highlights of our trip. I'd like to thank the staff for making our stay a very memorable one. I'm sure in the future Hotel Berna will be mentioned & compared to any other Italian hotel we stay in. Of course if we find ourselves back in Milan, we will be heading straight for this hotel! Highly recommended.
reviews.title: A rare hotel

reviews.text: This place knows what customer service is; a personal website, a sms-message, great service/staff, helpful people who all seem to know you by your name. Close to the central train station and only a few stops from Brera or the Duomo by subway
reviews.title: This place keeps surprising me; my favorite hotel in Milano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Berna was everything I hoped it would be: top comfort, well-located and value for money. I really could not fault it. The room was ideal - lage bed with a modern bathroom, no noise despite being on the ground floor, facing the front and near a lift! Now, I am quite fussy about these things and I couldn't find anything to complain about. The breakfast was varied and constantly topped up by a vigilant and friendly staff. The free mini bar was a nice touch and I was pleased to see the availability of at least four computers with printers, free of charge to any guest who needed them.
reviews.title: An Excellent Choice!

reviews.text: We were here on a city break and could not have made a wiser choice of hotel.
reviews.title: Super Friendly Hotel

reviews.text: I have just completed two stays at the Hotel Berna in Milan, 5 nights and a single night. During my first stay I had a small single room on the 3rd floor - probably the one that an earlier reviewer complained about - so, okay it was tiny and dated, but the great location, super staff and free in room Internet, and an incredible breakfast buffet more than made up for it. My one night stay which followed the 5 consecutive nights, was on the 5th floor which has been completely remodeled. While not super plush, it is very comfortable and a good value. Most of all, the staff makes you feel at home.
reviews.title: Good hotel with good service

reviews.text: The hotel also has a nice bar where you can relax and nosh on free snacks served with your drink, and if you would rather not go out, the hotel will order dinner in for you.
reviews.title: Not highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff is super friendly and can help you with metro cards, maps, directions and whatever else you need. If I had one one suggestion for improvement it would be to offer free bottle of water in the room. The rubber duckie was very cute, but water would have served me better.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived from Florence by train to stay late afternoon and evening in Milan before flying back home early the next day. Chose this hotel based on the proximity to the train station as the options for getting to the airport the next morning were either by train or bus. Buses are located right outside the train station and we chose this option as it involved less handling of luggage up/down stairs or escalators and it was a Saturday departure so not as much worry re traffic hold ups. This hotel was excellent value, really a luxury boutique type hotel and it exceeded our expectations for the money spent. Check in was efficient and pleasant. The room was extremely clean with lovely linens and decorating. We were able to walk into the main tourist area of Milan in the evening from this location. A beautiful and extensive berakfast buffet opened at 7 am, sadly rushed as we had to leave to get the bus. Despite comments I had heard about Milan being an "industrial town" I was impressed as it is vibrant, cosmopolitan place where there is more going on than tourism; fun to look at all the big stores and ads of the fashion world. Hope to return one day for a longer stay and definately would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great in every way

reviews.text: I flew into Milan in May 2013 and stayed at Hotel Berna off and on while taking side trips around northern Italy (Padua, Venice, Cremona). It proved to be a wonderful home base. This hotel is a block away from the train station, so it is extremely convenient for train travel. Even more important to me was the level of helpfulness and kindness of the entire staff, from the people at the front desk to the breakfast staff and the porters who helped me with my luggage. Highly recommend!
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most Italian hotels think its the same . Air conditioner is not an air cooler. It never gets cold even if if you like to sleep in the nude. We had to do. You will also have to give up your keys to the room each time you leave the hotel room. When you prepay in full you will get a nasty SURPRISE called city tax of 4 euros a day per person. Elevator or "lifts" are so small just enough for one person at a time. Stairs are just as bad. Buffet breakfast and staff overall very nice. They should consider giving you a portable electric fan considering the clerks are using them at the reception but offer their clients an excuse. If you like cold drinks , ask for ice from the bar. Drinks seem to be slightly cold. The beds are usually twin stuck together and appear as if they are pseudo king size considering they are off by more than 3 inches in height so you will feel like your falling off the bed on to the other portion . Especially if your snuggling with your partner. You might feel that your're actually falling off the bed. The bed is also extra firm. Don't forget if you borrow the ironing board it might be torn as well as a faulty iron that has no steam. If you use it more than 30 minutes welcome to 6 euros. Runny eggs on the buffet.
reviews.title: Poor air cooler not air conditioner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Berna was our first port of call on arriving in Europe at the end of April 2013. Staff were welcoming, and the whole place had a cosy but classy feel to it. Our room, though a little small (it was the "comfort double") managed to have everything we needed, and was gracious and super clean. Beds were really comfortable and bathroom (again very compact!) was stocked with requisite toiletries, with the yellow rubber ducky inviting you to take him home being a delight!
reviews.title: Swiss class in lovely Milano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were only too helpful to point out recommended restos (try Mama Rosa!!), and Berna's own breakfast was excellent, in a lovely ambient dining room. Location of Berna is just great, being very close walk to Stazione Centrale. All in all, a terrific experience.
reviews.title: Above and beyond, and with a homey feel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from a two night stay at the Hotel Berna with mixed opinions. On the down side the room (a superior double) was very small with the smallest hotel bathroom I have ever seen. Luckily I am only 5ft 3" and of fairly small build, how a larger person could have even fitted in, never mind turned round I don't know. ( It was so narrow that I couldn't even stretch my arms out fully).
reviews.title: Some nice touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area is fine, not the most picturesque but certainly handy for taxis, trains and links to airport is perfect and whilst you are aware of the presences of "ladies of the night" it certainly doesn't feel intimidating. There were some lovely touches in the hotel such as the free soft drink minibar, bars of chocolate on the pillow, little cakes on offer in the bar, you get the feeling that the manager or owner has a very sweet tooth! The breakfast is great, so much choice that you can't possibly do it justice, but it really does cater for every diet and appetite. It's served from 7-11 which is also great. I found the staff on the whole to be friendly and courteous, organising taxis swiftly. I would stay here again however would be keen to request a room with a larger bathroom.
reviews.title: Pretty Nice

likes.disliked: — No view at all for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was pretty nice. The rooms are nice, if a little bit small. The location is fantastic if you are traveling by train. You can almost see the hotel when you walk out of the front door of the station. The subway is also right there.
reviews.title: Practical and clean

reviews.text: The front desk was helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Top breakfast!

reviews.text: Not the fanciest of places, but certainly centrally located with clean and fairly spacious rooms. Good, clean and spacious bathrooms. I stayed in the newer tower located across the street from the main lobby.
reviews.title: An Frustrating Milan Experience...
Wonderful Hotel

reviews.title: Ok hotel-but be warned

likes.disliked: — smelly rooms and no wake up call came through- front dest unconcerned

reviews.text: an upgrade the staff were very friendly it was all very clean and a beautiful Breakfast. The best tomatoes we had in Italy. If I ever
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay at the Berna
Berna -quality and value
reviews.text: go back to Milan I would stay there without a second thought.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were catching a train and came from Milan Airport on the
reviews.title: Congrats Berna on providing excellent quality for the price

reviews.text: Hotel Berna is a restful place to return to after the bustle of sightseeing and shopping in Milan. We stayed 3 nights and booked 2 rooms for our family of 5. One of our rooms was upgraded for free upon check-in and was most appreciated. Our kids loved the included buffet breakfast which had a wide range of muesli, fruit, potatoes, bacon and eggs (not to mention the pastries and chocolates). The staff are warm, friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, central hotel

reviews.text: The hotel's close proximity to Milan Central Station was also a plus, making it easy to access the Malpensa airport by the shuttle bus as well as catching trains to other towns eg Bellagio.
reviews.title: Great staff, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all Hotel Berna is a wonderful hotel and deserves its high rating on tripadvisor.
reviews.title: Adequate if you just need a place to overnight in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P.S. Milan Central Station itself is a place to be very wary of pickpocketers. We were swiftly pickpocketed after purchasing our train tickets on the first morning of our trip by two young girls on the train leaving the station.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Berna. The staff were very helpful and provided advice on nearby shopping, restaurants and transportation. Room was clean, quiet, and small. Most European hotels that are affordable have smaller rooms than North Americans are used to. Amenities are also lacking compared to what we're used to. Hotel Berna was excellent and I would stay there again
reviews.title: Class and convenience in Milan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had really good time over there.Good choice to celebrate our wedding anniversary ! Room was great (very clean, bad was very comfortable), breakfast - amazing, staff - helpful and so nice. Good location as we needed to go to the railway station early in the morning and it is only 10 min walk (maximum). I was a bit worried about being so close to the station but the street is nice and quite - no trouble at all.
reviews.title: Enjoyed everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you arrive at nearly midnight and you've been travelling for more than 10 hours, what you want is a friendly welcome, a smile and a cool, clean room. This is precisely what we had on arrival at this lovely little hotel.
reviews.title: Superb Little Hotel - Immaculately Clean, Friendly and Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night in the "basic" room, which whilst slightly old-fashioned, was immaculately clean with good bed linen, free soft drink mini bar, a clean bathroom and air conditioning. Due to circumstances beyond our control, our holiday was delayed and we had to stay another night at a moment's notice. We paid somewhat more than our previous deal (to be expected), but we were shown two different rooms so that we could be sure of our choice and we stayed in the "superior" rooms area of the hotel. These appear to be recently modernised and are larger, have wood laminate floors, simple furniture and larger bathrooms with plain white suites. Ours had twin beds, a window on to a courtyard with shutters, net and curtains as well as a bathroom with loo, bidet, wash hand basin and bath tub with a shower mounted on the wall and a glass screen. It was a powerful and pleasant shower with a little more room than the basic room version.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the tail end of a trip to Italy with family and friends, I planned to travel up to Milan (a city I'd not yet visited, though I had been to Italy twice before) on my own for a single day and night. I arrived on the train and within 40 minutes, I was able to walk to the hotel with my two rolling suitcases, check in, settle in, and then venture out again to begin my day of exploration. Prior to my arrival, I had received emails encouraging me to "personalize" my room, though I didn't take advantage of this. The staff was kind and helpful, almost eager to speak English, and they made it easy for me to check in early and they even upgraded my single room. The room was quite small but I was fully prepared for this, as all the information is clearly listed on the website. And really, it was perfect for what I needed -- a safe and clean homebase for a solo traveler more interested in exploring the city than spending time in the hotel. Clearly, the room had recently been redone (the interior of the room didn't quite jive with the more staid and expected reception area and hallways) but I was quite pleased by the small space. There were a large number of light switches that took a while to figure out (including some blue accent lighting for the bathroom). My window opened completely, the mini-fridge was stocked with free (non-alcoholic) items, and there were enough of electrical outlets. As far as perks go, I was particularly pleased with the towel warmers in the bathroom and the adorable rubber duckie that comes with a note encouraging you to take him home, complete with a quote that reads "A day without laughter is a day wasted." Seriously, the space taken up by the bathroom was almost equivalent to the space for the bedroom. Shower only but there was a bidet, of course. Hallway/general hotel noise was minimal during the night and I slept well. Wifi was free and pretty reliable (though I had to wait a little while before I could access it, as I had checked in early). Check-out in the morning was quick. They're definitely used to travelers like me who just want an easy experience as they set out to explore.

reviews.text: You'll need to take the subway (or be prepared for a longish walk) in order to get to the center of the tourist attractions (three stops away), but as long as you don't mind being away from the hotel all day, it's worth it to not cart your luggage far from the transport hub. Additionally, if you take advantage of the buses to the airport (they might say it takes 40 minutes to get there but really it takes 60), then you'll be quite close to where you catch those beside the train station. Still, for solo travelers who just want a decent hotel as a jumping-off-point for their Milan tourist activities, I'd certainly recommend the Hotel Berna.
